transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs to change some things. Many people are leaving the Church. This is because the Church does not accept many things. The Church is not accepting of gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. These views are old. If the Church changed its views, it would not lose so many people. Some people are upset with the Church because they disagree with these views. For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not want to be part of a Church that says it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage. The Church is against abortion. If you believe in abortion, you may not want to be part of a Church that says it is wrong. The Church should allow women to be priests and priests to be married.  It is unfair that priests cannot have a family like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they love. A person's sexual orientation is a part of who they are. It is not a choice. So it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot. 

I don't think the government should be involved in people's personal lives. Marriage is a personal decision. 

I think it is unfair to treat gay people differently. They deserve the same rights as everyone else.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason to say no. Some people think gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are both relationships.  Many rights go with being married. Like health care. If you are sick, your partner can visit you in the hospital. But if you are not married, they may not be allowed. 
Many studies show gay couples are happy. They have the same problems and joys as straight couples. Gay people want the same thing: a legal marriage from the government. They are not asking for a church wedding.  
Some people say gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion. 
It is unfair to treat gay couples differently. It is like segregation. It is not fair.
People worry about children of gay couples.  But gay parents are just as good as straight parents. Their children will be fine.
The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. Every person should have the same rights. President Bush does not like gay marriage. He thinks it is wrong. But the government should not make laws based on religion.
Some people say gay people are sick. But this is not true. 
People should listen to experts, not just what their friends say.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see medicines every day. Some medicines are bad for you. Some medicines are good for you.

I think it is wrong to say that all illegal drugs are bad. Some illegal drugs can help people.

If a drug can help people, it should be legal.

Some drugs are illegal, but hospitals use them.

Oxycotton, Vicodin, Percocet, these are illegal drugs, but doctors use them. They help people.

If a drug can help, we should not be afraid of it. We should be open to using it.

Alcohol is legal, but it can also be bad.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. It is not as bad.

We should make marijuana legal slowly. We should not make it legal all at once. Slowly, people will learn to use it safely.

People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change how people think about it, they will be more careful with it.

Marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

If we make marijuana legal, people can use it safely. It can also help people.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. 

Now that I am older, they have a special mass for teenagers. It is thirty minutes long, and people dress more casually. In the summer, people come straight from the beach. Even at the morning masses, where I used to dress up, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is the dress code. I don't know about the church's politics, but this is what I have seen.

As for the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped these problems. Some married men become pedophiles. It is a person's choice to become a priest, and some religions allow married priests. If someone wants to practice their faith and be married, they could consider a different religion.

I think pedophilia has to do with genetics. People are born that way. It is not something they learn.  It is not something marriage can change.

I was okay with the war idea at first. But the September 11th attacks made things different. I think the Bush people used the attacks to start the war. They said Saddam Hussein was bad and had weapons. This was not true. It makes me angry.
The Bush people lied to the people. Colin Powell even said he was not sure about the evidence when he talked to the United Nations. This is wrong. It is against the law.
I think the Bush people do not care about the Constitution. They want more power. They wanted to fight a war.

The treasury secretary said that the younger Bush wanted to punish Saddam Hussein because his father could not. He also wanted more oil. This is bad.
The war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war. More people will die.
The United Nations wants other countries to help, like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could make more problems. Iraq needs to be its own country.
The government is not working well. The prime minister does not have much control. Bad people are fighting for power.
I do not like this situation. It is very complicated.

I feel the war in Iraq is not good. It is not a real war because Congress did not declare it. I think we went to Iraq to get back at them for the attacks on September 11. I do not like the war. I do not know many details. I think we are staying there to build a democracy, but that might not work. Democracy takes time. 

I am not sure what is best to do. If we leave, Iraq may be angry. If we stay, it may take a long time to build democracy. It is hard. I do not know much about the war.

Maybe we should not have called it a war in the first place. 


I think it is not fair that we are using guns. It seems like we want to show that we are strong. I do not think we should call it a war because it was not declared by Congress.

Staying in Iraq is hard. It is bad for President Bush. People may think he is a bad president like President Johnson was after Vietnam. 

There are people I know whose children are in Iraq. I want them to be safe. But Iraq is different from us. We should not try to make them like us. It may make things worse.

I do not think it is right for the government to make this legal. It is a matter for the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear. Trying to make it legal or illegal would go against the Constitution. It is like choosing one church's beliefs over another. Many Catholics and Christians do not support this.  
The government should not say what churches can and cannot do. Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States.  A new law about this would go against what is already in the Constitution. It would be one of the few laws that restrict people instead of the government.
I do not think the government should be involved. The person pushing for this law is doing so because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing that he prefers his religion over others. The churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for a law like this. It does not help the economy or society. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue.  I think the government was not truthful with the American people about why they went to war. They tried to link the war to the September 11th terrorist attacks, even though those events were not closely related. The government used the fear and anger after September 11th to get people to support the war. The war began in 2003. 

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. I believe the Iraq war was a mistake, much like the Vietnam War. The US government should have learned from its past errors. Many American soldiers have died in Iraq, and that is tragic.

The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to put in a new democratic government. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the US tried to remove Communists and support democracy. However, these types of efforts are difficult and often do not work.  

The US government was not prepared for the challenges of rebuilding Iraq after removing the government. There was a lot of chaos and violence. Insurgents, ordinary citizens who oppose the US presence, made it hard to create a stable country.

The US government should have planned for all possible outcomes before going to war. I believe they were not prepared for the difficulties of rebuilding Iraq and misled the American people about how easy it would be. 

The war has lasted a long time, and many American soldiers continue to die. It is difficult to say when the war will end. We are still training Iraqi soldiers and police to maintain security.

It is hard to know what to do now. We have been in Iraq for so long, and it is difficult to leave. However, the cost in American lives is very high. We need to carefully consider whether continuing the war is worth the price.

Some people argue that we should stay in Iraq to ensure the safety of the Iraqi people. But others say that we should let the Iraqi people decide their own fate. 

I think it is important to remember that the war in Iraq is not just about oil or weapons. It is about human lives and the future of a country.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal choice. Studies show that it may be caused by biology, not just social factors. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it is wrong. 

I believe politics and government should not have a say in this. It is a personal matter, a family matter.

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs, go to work, and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to decide what marriage is. It is a personal decision. 

I have read that being gay may be caused by biology, not just how someone is raised. 

The biggest problem is that gay couples face more attention than straight couples. If a man and a woman get married, no one cares. But if two men or two women get married, it is news. 

Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

When you put something on the internet, it is public.  

Anyone can see it. As a resident assistant, I have seen this. 

If you post something online, it will affect how people see you. If you talk about hurting people or violence, someone will notice. You cannot put that out into the world. The internet is for everyone.

If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you will see their posts. The school did not get this information from the internet. Someone told them. The school has to act. They cannot ignore it because if something happens, they could be blamed.

But you cannot always know what is serious. Some people joke around. It could be a school project gone wrong, or it could be real danger. In this case, someone heard something and told the school. They looked at the student's Facebook page and were worried. Some things on the page seemed like a joke, but in this situation, they were serious.

When you put things online, there is no privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. You cannot control what people think.

I do not think school officials should be friends with students on social media. They should not look at their pages. But if someone tells the school about something dangerous, the school has to take it seriously. They cannot ignore it.

I do not think they should read texts or private messages. But if they are told about something, it is different.

I think the war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help a country have a fair democracy. But I think we lost that goal. Now, maybe we are fighting just to show we are strong.

I also think the original reason for the war was not good. It may have been because George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. 

If the goal was to give democracy to a country without it, that would be a good reason to go to war. But if there were personal reasons, that would be wrong.

The war started strong, but it has gone on for too long. It has been many years. It hurts our country’s money. We have problems at home, like poverty, that need help. We should spend money on those things, not on a war that has no clear goal.

We should have stopped the war a long time ago. The people in that country will have to take care of themselves.  We are spending a lot of money on the war, money we could use for things like schools, roads, and healthcare. Those are important things that need help. We should not spend money to kill our own people in a war that we no longer have a good reason for.

I have a question. Can someone tell me if it is right to look at peoples' Myspace profiles to keep them safe?

One person found information on Myspace that stopped a bad thing from happening. I do not think looking at someone's Myspace is wrong because if you put information on the internet, people can see it.  On Myspace you need to be friends with someone to see their profile, but if you are friends, you give them permission to see it.

If you put information online, you should know that many people can see it.

It is hard to say if it is right to look at profiles to prevent harm because it might be seen as discrimination. You cannot have someone watching all the profiles to stop bad things, but what if they saw something that showed someone was making a plan to do something bad?

I have a Facebook account and it worries me that people can see things about me. I saw a story about a man who got information from a girl's profile and talked to her on instant messenger. He met her quickly. I would never meet someone like that.

People in my class have IM'd me using names I do not know. They know who I am and where I am. They know my friends and interests. I try to limit what I put on Facebook, but I need it to talk to friends. It is hard to find a balance.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. I do not know if they have the right to do that.

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. It feels wrong to join everyone else who says they were against it from the start. But I was. 

It is clear that most people think the war was a mistake. Polls show that 75 to 80 percent of people around the world, including Iraqis and even U.S. troops still there, believe it was a bad idea. 

The war was a disaster before it started and it is still a disaster now. Leaving will also be hard, but there is no easy way out of the situation in the Middle East.

The problem is a big cultural difference between the U.S. and the Middle East. American leaders don't understand this difference and think they can force democracy on a place where it doesn't fit.

 Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought carefully before invading Iraq. It has become a huge problem.

I don't see any reason to stay. I've heard no good reasons why we should stay longer.

If we leave slowly over a year or so, I could understand that. But I don't see a reason to stay any longer.

Most Iraqis want us to leave. Maybe they know better than we do.

If we ask them if they want us to leave and they say yes, then it's their decision. We can't be blamed if things go wrong after that. 

Maybe we could be seen as the good guys if we listen to them and leave. 

I know we'll never be truly good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think sexism is still a problem in the United States. It is not just women who face it.  

I believe it depends on the type of work. Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, some people have trouble accepting a man working under a woman. This is because society has been this way for a long time.

Women may have the skills for a job, but they might not get promoted. The board might not choose them because they are not used to seeing women in leadership roles. It's the same for men. 

For example, in some places like the fashion industry, men are not always taken seriously. People might not think they know about fashion if they are straight. It is hard to explain. 

Men staying home to care for children is also looked down upon. Society expects men to work and be the main money earner. 

Changing these ideas takes time. Society is slow to change. While women are getting into more leadership positions, it is a slow process. More people are accepting stay-at-home dads too.

We need to keep showing the good qualities of people who are often stereotyped. We should not be too pushy, but highlight their strengths. If we force change, people will resist.

We are making progress, but change takes time.

People say marijuana is not legal, but it is not a crime anymore. It is like a traffic ticket.  You get a ticket, but you do not go to jail. Many people worry about the future. Will it hurt their job search or other things? These things do not go away when it is not a crime.  It is expensive to arrest, hold, and try people for drug crimes. It costs a lot of money for the court, lawyers, and jails.

Some towns have money problems. They do not want to spend money on this, even if it would save them money. Some towns do not like marijuana and will not change the law. Other towns, like Denver, are more open to change. They think it is okay and the money saved can be used for schools, the elderly, and homeless people.

It is important to think about both sides. Marijuana should not be sold everywhere like cigarettes. It is still seen as bad in many places. People may feel uncomfortable seeing it everywhere.

Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can hurt people's lives more. Both have bad effects. People react differently to drugs. Some people can control their use, others cannot.

I say yes.

The Catholic Church has many good traditions. It is good to be rooted in tradition. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They are strict on how things are done. Sometimes, I feel the Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly.

They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also do not accept people of other religions.

My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of his religion. This is not being tolerant of other religions.

We learned to love others. This is a Catholic teaching. But it is hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them.

The Catholic Church tells you to do things, but the practice goes against it. It is outdated, but they keep doing it.

I think it would be good if priests could marry. But this would not stop bad things from happening. 

People who harm children would do it anyway. It is different from harming a spouse.

Allowing priests to marry would not stop bad things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about this. I do not know if either side is right or wrong. This is a difficult topic. It is about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage. This is hard to do without hurting people's feelings.

I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if the government should define marriage. Marriage is a religious ceremony. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment from the government just because they are baptized.

If people are married, the government should see it as a civil union. It is about two people. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

Gay marriage is the same. It is two people in a civil union.

If all the states agree, they should make it a federal law. But, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not a good idea. The constitution should not be changed for this. It is an important issue for some people, but not important enough to change the constitution. 

It is not important enough to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide for itself.

Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. You chose to live there, so you should accept their decision.

All people should have the same chances. I think gay people should be treated the same as straight people. That is why I think it should be legal, but each state should decide.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. Each state should decide for itself. I do not agree with his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think Bush lives in every state, so he should not tell them what to do. Some things should be up to each state. He will be out of office soon. If a Democratic president comes in, he may change the law. It will just keep going back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public place. People can see what you post. If you post something on Myspace, you should know that others will see it. This includes school officials. 

Even if they do not use the school's name, they can still see it from their homes. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post if they are trying to keep the school safe. 

If they can stop a school shooting, that is a good thing. It is the school's job to keep students safe.

It is different if they go on Myspace just to look for students doing bad things, like drinking or smoking. That is an invasion of privacy. But if they are trying to keep everyone safe, it is not wrong.

It is important to remember that anything you post on the internet can be seen by others, even if you did not expect it. It is always best to be careful about what you post online.

I supported the war at first.  Nine Eleven affected me personally. I wanted to fight back. I think our strong feelings about Nine Eleven made us make mistakes. We went into the war without a good plan. 
I regret that. I don't think the war was helpful. The people there are fighting each other. We can't solve that. I have lost interest in what happens there.  It is hard to care about people who fight each other so much. 
I don't think we were prepared for war there. War is different for them than for us. They are very violent. I think they want us to leave. That is fine with me. We should go home. 
I think we were too angry, not thinking clearly. I don't think we understood what would happen. 
The war was about revenge. President Bush wanted to punish them. I understand why he did it. 
We had to do something after Nine Eleven. They attacked us. We could not ignore it. 
But we did not plan well. We did not know what to do after the war started. There was no agreement on what we wanted to achieve. 
I think our anger led to more anger.
I don't think we can change them. I think they will always fight. I don't know what to say anymore. 

The war has lasted too long. We have made some progress, but not enough. They will go back to fighting when we leave. We cannot stay forever. Staying there is hurting us.

Once we leave, it’s just gonna collapse 
And we can’t stay over there forever 
So I think we’re just hurting ourselves by staying over there 
No 
Ok
transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs to change some things. Many people are leaving the Church. This is because the Church does not accept many things. The Church is not accepting of gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. These views are old. If the Church changed its views, it would not lose so many people. Some people are upset with the Church because they disagree with these views. For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not want to be part of a Church that says it is wrong. The same is true for gay marriage. The Church is against abortion. If you believe in abortion, you may not want to be part of a Church that says it is wrong. The Church should allow women to be priests and priests to be married.  It is unfair that priests cannot have a family like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they love. A person's sexual orientation is a part of who they are. It is not a choice. So it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot. 

I don't think the government should be involved in people's personal lives. Marriage is a personal decision. 

I think it is unfair to treat gay people differently. They deserve the same rights as everyone else.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason to say no. Some people think gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are both relationships.  Many rights go with being married. Like health care. If you are sick, your partner can visit you in the hospital. But if you are not married, they may not be allowed. 
Many studies show gay couples are happy. They have the same problems and joys as straight couples. Gay people want the same thing: a legal marriage from the government. They are not asking for a church wedding.  
Some people say gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion. 
It is unfair to treat gay couples differently. It is like segregation. It is not fair.
People worry about children of gay couples.  But gay parents are just as good as straight parents. Their children will be fine.
The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. Every person should have the same rights. President Bush does not like gay marriage. He thinks it is wrong. But the government should not make laws based on religion.
Some people say gay people are sick. But this is not true. 
People should listen to experts, not just what their friends say.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see medicines every day. Some medicines are bad for you. Some medicines are good for you.

I think it is wrong to say that all illegal drugs are bad. Some illegal drugs can help people.

If a drug can help people, it should be legal.

Some drugs are illegal, but hospitals use them.

Oxycotton, Vicodin, Percocet, these are illegal drugs, but doctors use them. They help people.

If a drug can help, we should not be afraid of it. We should be open to using it.

Alcohol is legal, but it can also be bad.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. It is not as bad.

We should make marijuana legal slowly. We should not make it legal all at once. Slowly, people will learn to use it safely.

People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change how people think about it, they will be more careful with it.

Marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

If we make marijuana legal, people can use it safely. It can also help people.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. 

Now that I am older, they have a special mass for teenagers. It is thirty minutes long, and people dress more casually. In the summer, people come straight from the beach. Even at the morning masses, where I used to dress up, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is the dress code. I don't know about the church's politics, but this is what I have seen.

As for the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped these problems. Some married men become pedophiles. It is a person's choice to become a priest, and some religions allow married priests. If someone wants to practice their faith and be married, they could consider a different religion.

I think pedophilia has to do with genetics. People are born that way. It is not something they learn.  It is not something marriage can change.

I was okay with the war idea at first. But the September 11th attacks made things different. I think the Bush people used the attacks to start the war. They said Saddam Hussein was bad and had weapons. This was not true. It makes me angry.
The Bush people lied to the people. Colin Powell even said he was not sure about the evidence when he talked to the United Nations. This is wrong. It is against the law.
I think the Bush people do not care about the Constitution. They want more power. They wanted to fight a war.

The treasury secretary said that the younger Bush wanted to punish Saddam Hussein because his father could not. He also wanted more oil. This is bad.
The war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war. More people will die.
The United Nations wants other countries to help, like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could make more problems. Iraq needs to be its own country.
The government is not working well. The prime minister does not have much control. Bad people are fighting for power.
I do not like this situation. It is very complicated.

I feel the war in Iraq is not good. It is not a real war because Congress did not declare it. I think we went to Iraq to get back at them for the attacks on September 11. I do not like the war. I do not know many details. I think we are staying there to build a democracy, but that might not work. Democracy takes time. 

I am not sure what is best to do. If we leave, Iraq may be angry. If we stay, it may take a long time to build democracy. It is hard. I do not know much about the war.

Maybe we should not have called it a war in the first place. 


I think it is not fair that we are using guns. It seems like we want to show that we are strong. I do not think we should call it a war because it was not declared by Congress.

Staying in Iraq is hard. It is bad for President Bush. People may think he is a bad president like President Johnson was after Vietnam. 

There are people I know whose children are in Iraq. I want them to be safe. But Iraq is different from us. We should not try to make them like us. It may make things worse.

I do not think it is right for the government to make this legal. It is a matter for the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear. Trying to make it legal or illegal would go against the Constitution. It is like choosing one church's beliefs over another. Many Catholics and Christians do not support this.  
The government should not say what churches can and cannot do. Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States.  A new law about this would go against what is already in the Constitution. It would be one of the few laws that restrict people instead of the government.
I do not think the government should be involved. The person pushing for this law is doing so because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing that he prefers his religion over others. The churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for a law like this. It does not help the economy or society. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue.  I think the government was not truthful with the American people about why they went to war. They tried to link the war to the September 11th terrorist attacks, even though those events were not closely related. The government used the fear and anger after September 11th to get people to support the war. The war began in 2003. 

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. I believe the Iraq war was a mistake, much like the Vietnam War. The US government should have learned from its past errors. Many American soldiers have died in Iraq, and that is tragic.

The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to put in a new democratic government. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the US tried to remove Communists and support democracy. However, these types of efforts are difficult and often do not work.  

The US government was not prepared for the challenges of rebuilding Iraq after removing the government. There was a lot of chaos and violence. Insurgents, ordinary citizens who oppose the US presence, made it hard to create a stable country.

The US government should have planned for all possible outcomes before going to war. I believe they were not prepared for the difficulties of rebuilding Iraq and misled the American people about how easy it would be. 

The war has lasted a long time, and many American soldiers continue to die. It is difficult to say when the war will end. We are still training Iraqi soldiers and police to maintain security.

It is hard to know what to do now. We have been in Iraq for so long, and it is difficult to leave. However, the cost in American lives is very high. We need to carefully consider whether continuing the war is worth the price.

Some people argue that we should stay in Iraq to ensure the safety of the Iraqi people. But others say that we should let the Iraqi people decide their own fate. 

I think it is important to remember that the war in Iraq is not just about oil or weapons. It is about human lives and the future of a country.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal choice. Studies show that it may be caused by biology, not just social factors. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it is wrong. 

I believe politics and government should not have a say in this. It is a personal matter, a family matter.

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs, go to work, and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to decide what marriage is. It is a personal decision. 

I have read that being gay may be caused by biology, not just how someone is raised. 

The biggest problem is that gay couples face more attention than straight couples. If a man and a woman get married, no one cares. But if two men or two women get married, it is news. 

Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

When you put something on the internet, it is public.  

Anyone can see it. As a resident assistant, I have seen this. 

If you post something online, it will affect how people see you. If you talk about hurting people or violence, someone will notice. You cannot put that out into the world. The internet is for everyone.

If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you will see their posts. The school did not get this information from the internet. Someone told them. The school has to act. They cannot ignore it because if something happens, they could be blamed.

But you cannot always know what is serious. Some people joke around. It could be a school project gone wrong, or it could be real danger. In this case, someone heard something and told the school. They looked at the student's Facebook page and were worried. Some things on the page seemed like a joke, but in this situation, they were serious.

When you put things online, there is no privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. You cannot control what people think.

I do not think school officials should be friends with students on social media. They should not look at their pages. But if someone tells the school about something dangerous, the school has to take it seriously. They cannot ignore it.

I do not think they should read texts or private messages. But if they are told about something, it is different.

I think the war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help a country have a fair democracy. But I think we lost that goal. Now, maybe we are fighting just to show we are strong.

I also think the original reason for the war was not good. It may have been because George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. 

If the goal was to give democracy to a country without it, that would be a good reason to go to war. But if there were personal reasons, that would be wrong.

The war started strong, but it has gone on for too long. It has been many years. It hurts our country’s money. We have problems at home, like poverty, that need help. We should spend money on those things, not on a war that has no clear goal.

We should have stopped the war a long time ago. The people in that country will have to take care of themselves.  We are spending a lot of money on the war, money we could use for things like schools, roads, and healthcare. Those are important things that need help. We should not spend money to kill our own people in a war that we no longer have a good reason for.

I have a question. Can someone tell me if it is right to look at peoples' Myspace profiles to keep them safe?

One person found information on Myspace that stopped a bad thing from happening. I do not think looking at someone's Myspace is wrong because if you put information on the internet, people can see it.  On Myspace you need to be friends with someone to see their profile, but if you are friends, you give them permission to see it.

If you put information online, you should know that many people can see it.

It is hard to say if it is right to look at profiles to prevent harm because it might be seen as discrimination. You cannot have someone watching all the profiles to stop bad things, but what if they saw something that showed someone was making a plan to do something bad?

I have a Facebook account and it worries me that people can see things about me. I saw a story about a man who got information from a girl's profile and talked to her on instant messenger. He met her quickly. I would never meet someone like that.

People in my class have IM'd me using names I do not know. They know who I am and where I am. They know my friends and interests. I try to limit what I put on Facebook, but I need it to talk to friends. It is hard to find a balance.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. I do not know if they have the right to do that.

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. It feels wrong to join everyone else who says they were against it from the start. But I was. 

It is clear that most people think the war was a mistake. Polls show that 75 to 80 percent of people around the world, including Iraqis and even U.S. troops still there, believe it was a bad idea. 

The war was a disaster before it started and it is still a disaster now. Leaving will also be hard, but there is no easy way out of the situation in the Middle East.

The problem is a big cultural difference between the U.S. and the Middle East. American leaders don't understand this difference and think they can force democracy on a place where it doesn't fit.

 Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought carefully before invading Iraq. It has become a huge problem.

I don't see any reason to stay. I've heard no good reasons why we should stay longer.

If we leave slowly over a year or so, I could understand that. But I don't see a reason to stay any longer.

Most Iraqis want us to leave. Maybe they know better than we do.

If we ask them if they want us to leave and they say yes, then it's their decision. We can't be blamed if things go wrong after that. 

Maybe we could be seen as the good guys if we listen to them and leave. 

I know we'll never be truly good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think sexism is still a problem in the United States. It is not just women who face it.  

I believe it depends on the type of work. Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, some people have trouble accepting a man working under a woman. This is because society has been this way for a long time.

Women may have the skills for a job, but they might not get promoted. The board might not choose them because they are not used to seeing women in leadership roles. It's the same for men. 

For example, in some places like the fashion industry, men are not always taken seriously. People might not think they know about fashion if they are straight. It is hard to explain. 

Men staying home to care for children is also looked down upon. Society expects men to work and be the main money earner. 

Changing these ideas takes time. Society is slow to change. While women are getting into more leadership positions, it is a slow process. More people are accepting stay-at-home dads too.

We need to keep showing the good qualities of people who are often stereotyped. We should not be too pushy, but highlight their strengths. If we force change, people will resist.

We are making progress, but change takes time.

People say marijuana is not legal, but it is not a crime anymore. It is like a traffic ticket.  You get a ticket, but you do not go to jail. Many people worry about the future. Will it hurt their job search or other things? These things do not go away when it is not a crime.  It is expensive to arrest, hold, and try people for drug crimes. It costs a lot of money for the court, lawyers, and jails.

Some towns have money problems. They do not want to spend money on this, even if it would save them money. Some towns do not like marijuana and will not change the law. Other towns, like Denver, are more open to change. They think it is okay and the money saved can be used for schools, the elderly, and homeless people.

It is important to think about both sides. Marijuana should not be sold everywhere like cigarettes. It is still seen as bad in many places. People may feel uncomfortable seeing it everywhere.

Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can hurt people's lives more. Both have bad effects. People react differently to drugs. Some people can control their use, others cannot.

I say yes.

The Catholic Church has many good traditions. It is good to be rooted in tradition. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They are strict on how things are done. Sometimes, I feel the Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly.

They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also do not accept people of other religions.

My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of his religion. This is not being tolerant of other religions.

We learned to love others. This is a Catholic teaching. But it is hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them.

The Catholic Church tells you to do things, but the practice goes against it. It is outdated, but they keep doing it.

I think it would be good if priests could marry. But this would not stop bad things from happening. 

People who harm children would do it anyway. It is different from harming a spouse.

Allowing priests to marry would not stop bad things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about this. I do not know if either side is right or wrong. This is a difficult topic. It is about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage. This is hard to do without hurting people's feelings.

I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if the government should define marriage. Marriage is a religious ceremony. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment from the government just because they are baptized.

If people are married, the government should see it as a civil union. It is about two people. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

Gay marriage is the same. It is two people in a civil union.

If all the states agree, they should make it a federal law. But, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not a good idea. The constitution should not be changed for this. It is an important issue for some people, but not important enough to change the constitution. 

It is not important enough to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide for itself.

Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. You chose to live there, so you should accept their decision.

All people should have the same chances. I think gay people should be treated the same as straight people. That is why I think it should be legal, but each state should decide.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. Each state should decide for itself. I do not agree with his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think Bush lives in every state, so he should not tell them what to do. Some things should be up to each state. He will be out of office soon. If a Democratic president comes in, he may change the law. It will just keep going back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public place. People can see what you post. If you post something on Myspace, you should know that others will see it. This includes school officials. 

Even if they do not use the school's name, they can still see it from their homes. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post if they are trying to keep the school safe. 

If they can stop a school shooting, that is a good thing. It is the school's job to keep students safe.

It is different if they go on Myspace just to look for students doing bad things, like drinking or smoking. That is an invasion of privacy. But if they are trying to keep everyone safe, it is not wrong.

It is important to remember that anything you post on the internet can be seen by others, even if you did not expect it. It is always best to be careful about what you post online.

I supported the war at first.  Nine Eleven affected me personally. I wanted to fight back. I think our strong feelings about Nine Eleven made us make mistakes. We went into the war without a good plan. 
I regret that. I don't think the war was helpful. The people there are fighting each other. We can't solve that. I have lost interest in what happens there.  It is hard to care about people who fight each other so much. 
I don't think we were prepared for war there. War is different for them than for us. They are very violent. I think they want us to leave. That is fine with me. We should go home. 
I think we were too angry, not thinking clearly. I don't think we understood what would happen. 
The war was about revenge. President Bush wanted to punish them. I understand why he did it. 
We had to do something after Nine Eleven. They attacked us. We could not ignore it. 
But we did not plan well. We did not know what to do after the war started. There was no agreement on what we wanted to achieve. 
I think our anger led to more anger.
I don't think we can change them. I think they will always fight. I don't know what to say anymore. 

The war has lasted too long. We have made some progress, but not enough. They will go back to fighting when we leave. We cannot stay forever. Staying there is hurting us.

The Church is not accepting of gay marriage, abortion, or birth control. These views are old. If the Church changed its views, it would not lose so many people. Some people are upset with the Church because they disagree with these views. For example, if someone believes in abortion, they may not want to be part of a Church that says it is wrong. The Church should allow women to be priests and priests to be married.  It is unfair that priests cannot have a family like everyone else.

I am not against gay marriage. I think people should be able to marry who they love. A person's sexual orientation is a part of who they are. It is not a choice. So it is wrong to say that a man and a woman can get married, but two people of the same sex cannot. 

I don't think the government should be involved in people's personal lives. Marriage is a personal decision. 

I think it is unfair to treat gay people differently. They deserve the same rights as everyone else.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason to say no. Some people think gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are both relationships.  Many rights go with being married. Like health care. If you are sick, your partner can visit you in the hospital. But if you are not married, they may not be allowed. 
Many studies show gay couples are happy. They have the same problems and joys as straight couples. Gay people want the same thing: a legal marriage from the government. They are not asking for a church wedding.  
Some people say gay marriage is wrong because of their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion. 
It is unfair to treat gay couples differently. It is like segregation. It is not fair.
People worry about children of gay couples.  But gay parents are just as good as straight parents. Their children will be fine.
The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. Every person should have the same rights. President Bush does not like gay marriage. He thinks it is wrong. But the government should not make laws based on religion.
Some people say gay people are sick. But this is not true. 
People should listen to experts, not just what their friends say.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I see medicines every day. Some medicines are bad for you. Some medicines are good for you.

I think it is wrong to say that all illegal drugs are bad. Some illegal drugs can help people.

If a drug can help people, it should be legal.

Some drugs are illegal, but hospitals use them.

Oxycotton, Vicodin, Percocet, these are illegal drugs, but doctors use them. They help people.

If a drug can help, we should not be afraid of it. We should be open to using it.

Alcohol is legal, but it can also be bad.

Marijuana is different from alcohol. It is not as bad.

We should make marijuana legal slowly. We should not make it legal all at once. Slowly, people will learn to use it safely.

People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change how people think about it, they will be more careful with it.

Marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine.

If we make marijuana legal, people can use it safely. It can also help people.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday. I always wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. 

Now that I am older, they have a special mass for teenagers. It is thirty minutes long, and people dress more casually. In the summer, people come straight from the beach. Even at the morning masses, where I used to dress up, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is the dress code. I don't know about the church's politics, but this is what I have seen.

As for the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped these problems. Some married men become pedophiles. The treasury secretary said that the younger Bush wanted to punish Saddam Hussein because his father could not. He also wanted more oil. This is bad.
The war has gone on too long. But if we leave now, Iraq might have a civil war. More people will die.
The United Nations wants other countries to help, like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But this could make more problems. Iraq needs to be its own country.
The government is not working well. The prime minister does not have much control. Bad people are fighting for power.
I do not like this situation. It is very complicated.

I feel the war in Iraq is not good. It is not a real war because Congress did not declare it. I think we went to Iraq to get back at them for the attacks on September 11. I do not like the war. I do not know many details. I think we are staying there to build a democracy, but that might not work. Democracy takes time. 

I am not sure what is best to do. If we leave, Iraq may be angry. If we stay, it may take a long time to build democracy. It is hard. I do not know much about the war.

Maybe we should not have called it a war in the first place. 


I think it is not fair that we are using guns. It seems like we want to show that we are strong. I do not think we should call it a war because it was not declared by Congress.

Staying in Iraq is hard. It is bad for President Bush. People may think he is a bad president like President Johnson was after Vietnam. 

There are people I know whose children are in Iraq. I want them to be safe. But Iraq is different from us. We should not try to make them like us. It may make things worse.

I do not think it is right for the government to make this legal. It is a matter for the churches. The Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear. Trying to make it legal or illegal would go against the Constitution. It is like choosing one church's beliefs over another. Many Catholics and Christians do not support this.  
The government should not say what churches can and cannot do. Separation of church and state is important for religious freedom in the United States.  A new law about this would go against what is already in the Constitution. It would be one of the few laws that restrict people instead of the government.
I do not think the government should be involved. The person pushing for this law is doing so because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing that he prefers his religion over others. The churches should decide this, not the government. There is no good reason for a law like this. It does not help the economy or society. It might even help society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue.  I think the government was not truthful with the American people about why they went to war. They tried to link the war to the September 11th terrorist attacks, even though those events were not closely related. The government used the fear and anger after September 11th to get people to support the war. The war began in 2003. 

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. I believe the Iraq war was a mistake, much like the Vietnam War. The US government should have learned from its past errors. Many American soldiers have died in Iraq, and that is tragic.

The US removed the Iraqi government and tried to put in a new democratic government. This is similar to what happened in Vietnam, where the US tried to remove Communists and support democracy. However, these types of efforts are difficult and often do not work.  

The US government was not prepared for the challenges of rebuilding Iraq after removing the government. There was a lot of chaos and violence. Insurgents, ordinary citizens who oppose the US presence, made it hard to create a stable country.

The US government should have planned for all possible outcomes before going to war. I believe they were not prepared for the difficulties of rebuilding Iraq and misled the American people about how easy it would be. 

The war has lasted a long time, and many American soldiers continue to die. It is difficult to say when the war will end. We are still training Iraqi soldiers and police to maintain security.

It is hard to know what to do now. We have been in Iraq for so long, and it is difficult to leave. However, the cost in American lives is very high. We need to carefully consider whether continuing the war is worth the price.

Some people argue that we should stay in Iraq to ensure the safety of the Iraqi people. But others say that we should let the Iraqi people decide their own fate. 

I think it is important to remember that the war in Iraq is not just about oil or weapons. It is about human lives and the future of a country.

I support gay marriage. I have always felt this way. I think it is a personal choice. Studies show that it may be caused by biology, not just social factors. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control. I think it is wrong. 

I believe politics and government should not have a say in this. It is a personal matter, a family matter.

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They walk their dogs, go to work, and live their lives. 

I think it is wrong for the government to try to decide what marriage is. It is a personal decision. 

I have read that being gay may be caused by biology, not just how someone is raised. 

The biggest problem is that gay couples face more attention than straight couples. If a man and a woman get married, no one cares. But if two men or two women get married, it is news. 

Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

When you put something on the internet, it is public.  

Anyone can see it. As a resident assistant, I have seen this. 

If you post something online, it will affect how people see you. If you talk about hurting people or violence, someone will notice. You cannot put that out into the world. The internet is for everyone.

If you are friends with someone on Myspace, you will see their posts. The school did not get this information from the internet. Someone told them. The school has to act. They cannot ignore it because if something happens, they could be blamed.

But you cannot always know what is serious. Some people joke around. It could be a school project gone wrong, or it could be real danger. In this case, someone heard something and told the school. They looked at the student's Facebook page and were worried. Some things on the page seemed like a joke, but in this situation, they were serious.

When you put things online, there is no privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. You cannot control what people think.

I do not think school officials should be friends with students on social media. They should not look at their pages. But if someone tells the school about something dangerous, the school has to take it seriously. They cannot ignore it.

I do not think they should read texts or private messages. But if they are told about something, it is different.

I think the war has gone on too long. At first, the goal was good. It was to help a country have a fair democracy. But I think we lost that goal. Now, maybe we are fighting just to show we are strong.

I also think the original reason for the war was not good. It may have been because George Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. 

If the goal was to give democracy to a country without it, that would be a good reason to go to war. But if there were personal reasons, that would be wrong.

The war started strong, but it has gone on for too long. It has been many years. It hurts our country’s money. We have problems at home, like poverty, that need help. We should spend money on those things, not on a war that has no clear goal.

We should have stopped the war a long time ago. The people in that country will have to take care of themselves.  We are spending a lot of money on the war, money we could use for things like schools, roads, and healthcare. Those are important things that need help. We should not spend money to kill our own people in a war that we no longer have a good reason for.

I have a question. Can someone tell me if it is right to look at peoples' Myspace profiles to keep them safe?

One person found information on Myspace that stopped a bad thing from happening. I do not think looking at someone's Myspace is wrong because if you put information on the internet, people can see it.  On Myspace you need to be friends with someone to see their profile, but if you are friends, you give them permission to see it.

If you put information online, you should know that many people can see it.

It is hard to say if it is right to look at profiles to prevent harm because it might be seen as discrimination. You cannot have someone watching all the profiles to stop bad things, but what if they saw something that showed someone was making a plan to do something bad?

I have a Facebook account and it worries me that people can see things about me. I saw a story about a man who got information from a girl's profile and talked to her on instant messenger. He met her quickly. I would never meet someone like that.

People in my class have IM'd me using names I do not know. They know who I am and where I am. They know my friends and interests. I try to limit what I put on Facebook, but I need it to talk to friends. It is hard to find a balance.

I heard that a high school banned Myspace. I do not know if they have the right to do that.

I feel bad talking about the Iraq War. It feels wrong to join everyone else who says they were against it from the start. But I was. 

It is clear that most people think the war was a mistake. Polls show that 75 to 80 percent of people around the world, including Iraqis and even U.S. troops still there, believe it was a bad idea. 

The war was a disaster before it started and it is still a disaster now. Leaving will also be hard, but there is no easy way out of the situation in the Middle East.

The problem is a big cultural difference between the U.S. and the Middle East. American leaders don't understand this difference and think they can force democracy on a place where it doesn't fit.

 Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought carefully before invading Iraq. It has become a huge problem.

I don't see any reason to stay. I've heard no good reasons why we should stay longer.

If we leave slowly over a year or so, I could understand that. But I don't see a reason to stay any longer.

Most Iraqis want us to leave. Maybe they know better than we do.

If we ask them if they want us to leave and they say yes, then it's their decision. We can't be blamed if things go wrong after that. 

Maybe we could be seen as the good guys if we listen to them and leave. 

I know we'll never be truly good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I think sexism is still a problem in the United States. It is not just women who face it.  

I believe it depends on the type of work. Women face challenges because of a "glass ceiling." Even though equality is important, some people have trouble accepting a man working under a woman. This is because society has been this way for a long time.

Women may have the skills for a job, but they might not get promoted. The board might not choose them because they are not used to seeing women in leadership roles. It's the same for men. 

For example, in some places like the fashion industry, men are not always taken seriously. People might not think they know about fashion if they are straight. It is hard to explain. 

Men staying home to care for children is also looked down upon. Society expects men to work and be the main money earner. 

Changing these ideas takes time. Society is slow to change. While women are getting into more leadership positions, it is a slow process. More people are accepting stay-at-home dads too.

We need to keep showing the good qualities of people who are often stereotyped. We should not be too pushy, but highlight their strengths. If we force change, people will resist.

We are making progress, but change takes time.

People say marijuana is not legal, but it is not a crime anymore. It is like a traffic ticket.  You get a ticket, but you do not go to jail. Many people worry about the future. Will it hurt their job search or other things? These things do not go away when it is not a crime.  It is expensive to arrest, hold, and try people for drug crimes. It costs a lot of money for the court, lawyers, and jails.

Some towns have money problems. They do not want to spend money on this, even if it would save them money. Some towns do not like marijuana and will not change the law. Other towns, like Denver, are more open to change. They think it is okay and the money saved can be used for schools, the elderly, and homeless people.

It is important to think about both sides. Marijuana should not be sold everywhere like cigarettes. It is still seen as bad in many places. People may feel uncomfortable seeing it everywhere.

Alcohol is worse for driving, but marijuana can hurt people's lives more. Both have bad effects. People react differently to drugs. Some people can control their use, others cannot.

I say yes.

The Catholic Church has many good traditions. It is good to be rooted in tradition. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They are strict on how things are done. Sometimes, I feel the Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly.

They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also do not accept people of other religions.

My dad was an Episcopalian. My mom was Catholic. They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of his religion. This is not being tolerant of other religions.

We learned to love others. This is a Catholic teaching. But it is hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them.

The Catholic Church tells you to do things, but the practice goes against it. It is outdated, but they keep doing it.

I think it would be good if priests could marry. But this would not stop bad things from happening. 

People who harm children would do it anyway. It is different from harming a spouse.

Allowing priests to marry would not stop bad things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about this. I do not know if either side is right or wrong. This is a difficult topic. It is about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage. This is hard to do without hurting people's feelings.

I think all civil unions should be equal. I do not know if the government should define marriage. Marriage is a religious ceremony. People do not get tax breaks or special treatment from the government just because they are baptized.

If people are married, the government should see it as a civil union. It is about two people. The government should not care what kind of marriage it is.

Gay marriage is the same. It is two people in a civil union.

If all the states agree, they should make it a federal law. But, a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not a good idea. The constitution should not be changed for this. It is an important issue for some people, but not important enough to change the constitution. 

It is not important enough to ban gay marriage.

I grew up in a Christian home. Homosexuality is hard for me to understand. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a big problem for the country. Each state should decide for itself.

Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. You chose to live there, so you should accept their decision.

All people should have the same chances. I think gay people should be treated the same as straight people. That is why I think it should be legal, but each state should decide.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should decide this for the whole country. Each state should decide for itself. I do not agree with his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think Bush lives in every state, so he should not tell them what to do. Some things should be up to each state. He will be out of office soon. If a Democratic president comes in, he may change the law. It will just keep going back and forth. Each state should decide for itself. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

Myspace is a public place. People can see what you post. If you post something on Myspace, you should know that others will see it. This includes school officials. 

Even if they do not use the school's name, they can still see it from their homes. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post if they are trying to keep the school safe. 

If they can stop a school shooting, that is a good thing. It is the school's job to keep students safe.

It is different if they go on Myspace just to look for students doing bad things, like drinking or smoking. That is an invasion of privacy. But if they are trying to keep everyone safe, it is not wrong.

It is important to remember that anything you post on the internet can be seen by others, even if you did not expect it. It is always best to be careful about what you post online.

I supported the war at first.  Nine Eleven affected me personally. I wanted to fight back. I think our strong feelings about Nine Eleven made us make mistakes. We went into the war without a good plan. 
I regret that. I don't think the war was helpful. The people there are fighting each other. We can't solve that. I have lost interest in what happens there.  It is hard to care about people who fight each other so much. 
I don't think we were prepared for war there. War is different for them than for us. They are very violent. I think they want us to leave. That is fine with me. We should go home. 
I think we were too angry, not thinking clearly. I don't think we understood what would happen. 
The war was about revenge. President Bush wanted to punish them. I understand why he did it. 
We had to do something after Nine Eleven. They attacked us. We could not ignore it. 
But we did not plan well. We did not know what to do after the war started. There was no agreement on what we wanted to achieve. 
I think our anger led to more anger.
I don't think we can change them. I think they will always fight. I don't know what to say anymore. 

The war has lasted too long. We have made some progress, but not enough. They will go back to fighting when we leave. We cannot stay forever. Staying there is hurting us.
